bibl.title: Letter from William N. Hill to [Howard A. Kelly?], December 7, 1907

div1.p: Hill comments on a strategy to lobby Congress for pension bills.

div1.head: Letter from William N. Hill to [Howard A. Kelly?], December 7, 1907
div1.opener:
DR. WM. N. HILL,
PRESIDENT.
DANIEL MACODROM,
SECRETARY.
Dr L
Twentieth Century Club
INCORPORATED UNDER THE LAWS OF MARYLAND
JANUARY 2, 1907.
CHARLES L. SWIGERT,
823 EQUITABLE BUILDING,
CHAIRMAN COMMITTEE OF ARRANGEMENTS
JAMESTOWN EXPOSITION EXCURSION.
508 W. Mulberry St
BALTIMORE, MD. Dec 7 1907
Dear Dr
div1.p:
I was in Washington yesterday and had
a long talk with Senator Latimer

As I know your interest in these
men Lazear Reed Carroll et al who were
volunteers in the yellow fever experiments I took
occasion to hold forth eloquently as possible
to the Senator on their acts. I told him the
whole story of the experiments as related by Howard
and yourself. He seemed quite interested
It occurs to me that if you still desire
to help the families of our confreres a move might
be advantageously made on these Southern and
Western Senators.

Our Drainage project has given me to enter
amongst them and I think we might be
able to compass a regular hearing before one
the Senates Committees before the winter is over.
If the Carroll memorial meeting could benefited
in sabutanus before one of three committees it
could be printed as a public document and fratered.
What do you think of this idea?
div1.closer: Very truly yours Wm N. Hill Ed.
